company.name: Te Tūāpapa Kura Kāinga - Ministry of Housing and Urban Development NZ

profile_positions.company: Te Tūāpapa Kura Kāinga - Ministry of Housing and Urban Development NZ
profile_positions.title: Policy Advisor

profile_positions.description:
- Managed the day-to-day operations of Homestar and Homefit residential certification tools by processing registrations and certifications, coordinating third-party audits, meeting with clients, monitoring the Technical Team’s inboxes and resolving technical questions. 
- Contributed to the development of rating tool updates through researching and drafting new/updated credits, organising workshops with our Expert Reference Panel, preparing consultation materials, and writing a consultation summary report. 
- Led data-management for the Technical Team and built multiple new databases to track certifications. I managed the initial stages of developing a web-app for Homestar including scoping and tendering, and coordinated multiple rounds of updates to the HomeFit web-app as the primary liaison with the external app-developers. 
- Led the drafting of NZGBC submissions on government consultations e.g. on the introduction of waste levies for construction and demolition waste.  
- Assisted the Communications and Marketing team to develop promotional material for the rating tools, write articles and blog posts, and organise events. 
- Assisted the Education team to develop and deliver training for Assessors and Auditors. 
- Coordinated NZGBC Future Thinkers (NZGBC students and young professionals network).
- Presented guest lectures on Green Building and building science.
profile_positions.title: Technical Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Part time role in the National Communications Centre.
- Monitoring field staff, and supplying information via phone and radio contact.
- Completing checks with agencies such as Police and NZTA.
- Ensuring safety of field staff by managing critical incidents and  initiating emergency procedures when necessary.
- Communicating with the public via the animal welfare and poacher helplines.
- Competent use of several ministry databases for timely retrieval of information.
profile_positions.title: Communications Centre Officer

volunteer_experiences.description:
- Provided up-to-date knowledge and insight to WCC around the environment, including water, energy, waste, biodiversity, urban design and transport management. This group met monthly to receive presentations from WCC Staff, comment on current policy proposals, and prepare submissions on WCC consultations.
- Portfolio lead for issues related to the Urban Design Agency and Urban Growth.

Campaign Coordinator & Policy Lead (local campaigns)
Co-Convener National Finance Committee & Wellington Treasurer

- Coordinated impactful local campaigns in Wellington city, like City for People, to empower people to engage with decision making, specifically on urban-planning and climate change issues. This involved developing strategies and theories of change, coordinating volunteers, organising events, and carrying out actions.
- Led development of Generation Zero’s policy positions on urban development issues. This involved research and policy analysis, submission drafting, and representing Generation Zero in consultations.
- Spokesperson on urban development issues. This involved holding media relationships, pitching issues, providing comments, writing and pitching opinion editorials, writing press releases. 
- Regularly convened meetings and hosted workshops within Generation Zero for our volunteers, and with the wider climate advocacy network, both on urban issues and on up-skilling in intersectional campaigning for climate justice. 
- Successfully secured meetings with Ministers, Members of Parliament, and City Councillors to advocate for progress on urban development issues. 
- Initiated a National Finance Committee and developed then implemented policy for managing finances and fundraising. 
- Led the development of a grant application for Generation Zero Wellington through multiple stages and secured significant funding.
- Held relationships council staff and wider government officials.
- Represented Generation Zero on the Ministry for the Environment’s Waste and Resource Efficiency Advisory Group, contributing to the development of a National Waste Strategy. 
- Represented Generation Zero on the Technical Working Group for Aotearoa Circle’s Sustainable Finance Forum.
- Represented Generation Zero in engagements with the Climate Change Commission.
